citations.title: [Discrimination in Online Ad Delivery]( (Sweeney, arXiv 2013) — Early work on algorithmic discrimination
[Gender Shades]( (Buolamwini & Gebru, 2018) — Facial recognition bias (relevant for video interviews)
[Bias in Resume Screening]( (Raghavan et al., arXiv 2019) — Automated resume screening
[Auditing AI Hiring Tools]( (Köchling & Wehner, CHI 2020) — Survey of bias in hiring AI
[Algorithmic Hiring Discrimination]( (Hoffman et al., SSRN 2020) — Legal analysis
[HireVue audit]( (EEOC, 2023) — Video interview platform
[LinkedIn job recommendations]( (Sapiezynski et al., arXiv 2022) — Gender bias in job ads
[Indeed resume screening]( (MIT Tech Review, 2021) — Investigative journalism
[Auditing Algorithms]( (Sandvig et al., ICA 2014) — Audit study methods
[Fairness Definitions Explained]( (Verma & Rubin, 2018) — Fairness metrics
[Causal Fairness Analysis]( (Kusner et al., NeurIPS 2017) — Causal approaches to fairness
**EEOC guidance** (2023): [AI and Title VII]( — Adverse impact analysis
[O'Neil Risk Consulting & Algorithmic Auditing (ORCAA)]( — Cathy O'Neil's firm
[ForHumanity]( — Independent audit certification
[Holistic AI]( — AI governance and auditing
[BABL AI]( — Bias testing for hiring platforms
[Amazon scraps secret AI recruiting tool]( (Reuters, 2018) — Gender bias in resume screening
[HireVue's AI faces scrutiny]( (Washington Post, 2019)
[Algorithmic Justice League]( — Buolamwini's organization
[AI Now Institute]( — Research and advocacy
[Data & Society]( — Research on tech and society
[Intersectional Fairness]( (Foulds et al., arXiv 2018) — Theoretical framework
[Intersectionality in AI]( (Scheuerman et al., CHI 2020) — General discussion
[Long-term Fairness]( (Liu et al., NeurIPS 2018) — Theoretical framework
[Bias in Large Language Models]( (Bender et al., arXiv 2021) — General LLM bias
[Candidate Reactions to AI Hiring]( (Langer et al., Computers in Human Behavior, 2020)
[Algorithmic Anxiety]( (Sannon et al., CSCW 2019)
[Debiasing Techniques]( (Mehrabi et al., arXiv 2019) — General debiasing
[Comparative Algorithm Audits]( (Bandy & Diakopoulos, CHI 2020) — General framework
[Occupation-Specific Bias]( (De-Arteaga et al., arXiv 2020) — Bias in occupation classification
[Cross-Cultural AI Fairness]( (Sambasivan et al., arXiv 2022) — General framework
**NYC DCWP**: [Local Law 144 compliance](
**EU AI Act**: [High-risk AI systems](
**Precedent**: [hiQ Labs v. LinkedIn]( (scraping public data is legal, but evolving)
Source: [Bertrand & Mullainathan (2004)](
**Impossibility results**: Some metrics are mutually exclusive ([Chouldechova, 2017](
1. **[Discrimination in Online Ad Delivery]( (Sweeney, arXiv 2013) — Early algorithmic discrimination work
2. **[Auditing Algorithms: Research Methods for Detecting Discrimination]( (Sandvig et al., ICA 2014) — Audit methodology
3. **[Gender Shades: Intersectional Accuracy Disparities]( (Buolamwini & Gebru, 2018) — Intersectional bias in facial recognition
4. **[Bias in Resume Screening Algorithms]( (Raghavan et al., arXiv 2019) — Resume screening bias
5. **[EEOC Guidance on AI and Title VII]( (EEOC, 2023) — Regulatory framework
6. **[NYC Local Law 144]( (NYC DCWP, 2023) — Bias audit requirements
[FAccT Conference]( — ACM Conference on Fairness, Accountability, and Transparency
